Text:
Pencilgon and Alpha set out to investigate the
surrounding forest in preparation for their
showdown with Wethermon. However...
Now for the...finishing blow!

Looks like we've taken out the monsters in this
area.

Yet it seems like there are still loads more ahead.
This doesn't bode well for our investigation.

Yes. Each monster isn't much of a threat on its own,
but they can be troublesome when they coordinate
as a group...

Let's call it a day. It's getting dark, and it's too
dangerous to continue.

Aww, but I'm still good to go. Don't you think
you're being overly cautious, Alpha?

It's better to be overly cautious. It's too late to
regret something once it happens.

True, but taking the easy road just isn't in my
nature.

(And even if it's probably just scrapped data, I
don't like the idea of leaving something that
resembles him on the loose.)

Didn't you spend a lot of time preparing when you
defeated Wethermon before?

But we have a fair number of people this time, don't
we? Besides, both you and Delta seem pretty skilled.
Still, I have no intention of changing our approach.
Hey, wait a second. Alphaaaa!

What she's saying makes sense, but I just wish...
there was a more efficient way to go about this...
...Hm? That herd of monstersâ€”
Oh, there you are. This way, over here!

What're we doing here this early in the morning?
I told you yesterday that I don't plan on changing
our strategy.

I get that, but I think you'll be on board with this
as well, Alpha.
What do you mean?
Well, seeing is believing, right? Come on, let's go!
A cave...? But why did you bring me here?
You'll see, come on!... Look, over there.
...A monster? It's a fairly large one...

Quite the prey, don't you think? I think the two of
us can hunt it down together.

*sigh* Fine. Let's take that thing down first, then
we'll talk.
Oh, you're not going to stop me?

Knowing you, I'm sure you have some sort of plan.
And besides...

Didn't you mention it not being in your nature to
take the easy road?
Ahahah! That's the spirit. Let's go then...!
Haahhh!
Impressive, Alpha! It was a piece of cake for you.

Quit messing around. Now tell me what this is all
about.

What do you think it's about? It's to make it easier
for us to investigate the forest.

When we were investigating the forest earlier,
I noticed a pattern in the monsters' movement.

After a little more digging around, I discovered
there was a monster leading them.

I see. So that monster we just defeated was their
leader.

With their leader gone, the rest of the monsters are
pretty much small fry.

...I said I wasn't going to change our strategy, but
it looks like I'll need to revise my statement.

Using a small elite team to ambush their leader in a
cave with little room to escape... It's not the most
cautious approach, but it certainly makes sense.

Right? Of course, preparation is essential, but
sometimes it's also important to take risks.
Perhaps I was being a little too cautious.

But next time, I'd appreciate it if you'd consult with
me beforehand. We should aim to minimize risk.
Of course. On that note, Alpha, I have an idea...

How about we hunt down the leader of the monsters on
the mountain? I've already uncovered their lair.
...I thought I mentioned consulting me beforehand.
Isn't that what I'm doing now?
That's not what I mean... *sigh* Oh well.

Despite Alpha's frustration at Pencilgon's
recklessness, the two head off to defeat
their next targetâ€”
